explanation: The report is correct. The code in init_response_body_data uses memcpy and indexed writes into body_dyn without validating that body_dyn_size is at least the sum of the header and footer lengths. If body_dyn_size < header_len (or < header_len + footer_len) the initial memcpy(body_dyn + pos, body_header, header_len) already overflows the allocated buffer. Even if header_len <= body_dyn_size but body_dyn_size < header_len + footer_len, the loop condition uses unsigned arithmetic: body_dyn_size - (header_len + footer_len) will underflow and become a very large size_t, causing the filler loop to write far beyond the buffer and leading the subsequent memcpy(body_dyn + pos, body_footer, footer_len) to also copy past the end of body_dyn. These are out-of-bounds accesses performed via memcpy / direct writes and therefore violate MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.17. The code must check that body_dyn_size >= header_len + footer_len (and header_len <= body_dyn_size before the first memcpy) before performing the copies or use safer bounded copying logic.
